question: What is the difference between <div> and <span>?
options: <div> is a block level element and <span> is inline
<div> is inline and <span> is block level
<div> is used for structure and <span> is used for styling
They are the same
answer: <div> is a block level element and <span> is inline

question: What is the difference between 'id' and 'class' attributes?
options: id is unique and class is not
class is unique and id is not
id is used for styling and class is used for structure
They are the same
answer: id is unique and class is not

question: What is the difference between <ol> and <ul>?
options: <ol> creates a numbered list and <ul> creates a bullet point list
<ol> creates a bullet point list and <ul> creates a numbered list
<ol> is used for images and <ul> is used for text
They are the same
answer: <ol> creates a numbered list and <ul> creates a bullet point list

question: What is the difference between <em> and <strong>?
options: <em> is used to indicate emphasis and <strong> is used to indicate importance
<em> is used to indicate importance and <strong> is used to indicate emphasis
<em> is used for italic and <strong> is used for bold
They are the same
answer: <em> is used to indicate emphasis and <strong> is used to indicate importance

question: What is the difference between <figure> and <figcaption>?
options: <figure> is used to group media elements and <figcaption> is used to provide a caption for the media
<figure> is used to provide a caption for the media and <figcaption> is used to group media elements
<figure> is used for images and <figcaption> is used for videos
They are the same
answer: <figure> is used to group media elements and <figcaption> is used to provide a caption for the media

question: What is the difference between <q> and <blockquote>?
options: <q> is used for short quotes and <blockquote> is used for long quotes
<q> is used for long quotes and <blockquote> is used for short quotes
<q> is used for styling and <blockquote> is used for semantics
They are the same
answer: <q> is used for short quotes and <blockquote> is used for long quotes

question: What is the difference between <mark> and <ins>?
options: <mark> is used to highlight text and <ins> is used to indicate text that has been added to a document
<ins> is used to highlight text and <mark> is used to indicate text that has been added to a document
<mark> is used for bold text and <ins> is used for underlined text
They are the same
answer: <mark> is used to highlight text and <ins> is used to indicate text that has been added to a document

question: What is the difference between <time> and <datetime>?
options: <time> is used for displaying time and <datetime> is used for providing machine-readable date and time information
<datetime> is used for displaying time and <time> is used for providing machine-readable date and time information
<time> is used for local time and <datetime> is used for UTC time
They are the same
answer: <time> is used for displaying time and <datetime> is used for providing machine-readable date and time information

question: What is the difference between <meter> and <progress>?
options: <meter> is used for displaying a scalar value within a known range and <progress> is used for displaying the completion progress of a task
<progress> is used for displaying a scalar value within a known range and <meter> is used for displaying the completion progress of a task
<meter> is used for showing data in a graph and <progress> is used for showing data in a bar chart
They are the same
answer: <meter> is used for displaying a scalar value within a known range and <progress> is used for displaying the completion progress of a task

question: What is the difference between <header> and <head>?
options: <header> is used for containing introductory content or a set of navigational links and <head> is used to provide information about the document, such as the title and meta data
<head> is used for containing introductory content or a set of navigational links and <header> is used to provide information about the document, such as the title and meta data
<header> is used for the top part of a webpage and <head> is used for the bottom part of a webpage
They are the same
answer: <header> is used for containing introductory content or a set of navigational links and <head> is used to provide information about the document, such as the title and meta data

question: What is the difference between <dl> and <ul>?
options: <dl> is used for creating definition lists and <ul> is used for creating unordered lists
<ul> is used for creating definition lists and <dl> is used for creating unordered lists
<dl> is used for creating lists with terms and descriptions and <ul> is used for creating simple bullet point lists
They are the same
answer: <dl> is used for creating definition lists and <ul> is used for creating unordered lists

question: What is the difference between <label> and <legend>?
options: <label> is used to provide a text description for a form control and <legend> is used to provide a caption for a fieldset element
<legend> is used to provide a text description for a form control and <label> is used to provide a caption for a fieldset element
<label> is used for input fields and <legend> is used for textarea fields
They are the same
answer: <label> is used to provide a text description for a form control and <legend> is used to provide a caption for a fieldset element

question: What is the difference between <b> and <i>?
options: <b> is used to make text bold and <i> is used to make text italic
<i> is used to make text bold and <b> is used to make text italic
<b> is used for bold text and <i> is used for underlined text
They are the same
answer: <b> is used to make text bold and <i> is used to make text italic

question: What is the difference between <section> and <article>?
options: <section> is used for grouping related content and <article> is used for self-contained content that could be independently distributable or syndicatable
<article> is used for grouping related content and <section> is used for self-contained content that could be independently distributable or syndicatable
<section> is used for headers and <article> is used for footers
They are the same
answer: <section> is used for grouping related content and <article> is used for self-contained content that could be independently distributable or syndicatable

question: What is the difference between <aside> and <nav>?
options: <aside> is used for content that is related to the main content, but not essential for understanding it, and <nav> is used for navigation links
<nav> is used for content that is related to the main content, but not essential for understanding it, and <aside> is used for navigation links
<aside> is used for sidebar content and <nav> is used for main content
They are the same
answer: <aside> is used for content that is related to the main content, but not essential for understanding it, and <nav> is used for navigation links
